Heart rate zones help you and your trainer see your workout’s intensity and cardiovascular strength. We’re using your biometric data to calculate the zones specifically for you.
This is a very relaxed, low-intensity zone. Training at this intensity will support your recovery and prepare you for training in the higher HR zones.
This zone improves your general endurance. It helps your body get better at burning fat, and your muscular fitness will increase along with your capillary density.
Zone 3 is especially effective for boosting the efficiency of blood circulation in your heart and skeletal muscles. In this zone, the annoying lactic acid starts to accumulate in your bloodstream.

Zone 4 is where it’s going to get hard to talk. You’ll be breathing hard and working anaerobically. Your body will improve the use of carbohydrates, and you will be able to withstand higher blood lactic acid levels longer.

Zone 5 is your maximum effort. Your heart and your respiratory system will be working at a maximum capacity. Lactic acid will build up in your blood, and you will not be able to continue at this intensity after a few minutes.

A former gymnast and now a feel-good workout enthusiast is here to help you find the very best version of yourself.

Emma brings a huge smile and lots of energy. Her emphasis is on cultivating a positive relationship with your body and mind. Under her guidance, you’re sure to find the very best version of yourself. \n\nHer long-term experience and enthusiasm will keep you motivated to reach your goal - whether it is losing weight, toning, or improving your flexibility.
Thanks to Emma my attitude towards working out has shifted. Working out is the highlight of my day as well as stepping on the scales and seeing that I lost 12 lbs since working with Emma.
I am an avid runner and Emma helps me to compensate for running with yoga and stretching. Thanks to her guidance I feel better and I run faster!
Whether you are working on toning, weight loss, or mobility, Mia will help you with your journey.

Mia’s style is fun and full of positive vibes and of course a lot of hard work, too. She’ll push you to your limits and leave you feeling empowered. \n\nHer approach is strong and she will not let you get away with not doing the work. On the other hand, you will feel like you can conquer the world.
I cannot recommend Mia enough! She helped me turn fat into muscle. I am not going to lie, it is hard work, but so worth it!

Mia helped me get my bearings - I feel so much better in body and in the place in life I am currently in. She responds to my questions extremely quickly and gives me that extra bit of nudge when I need it.

Carrie is the perfect coach to help you get fitter. Have your pick - endurance, toning, or HIIT. 

She strives to help others achieve lifelong health and wellness.

She is also a nutrition expert so don’t hesitate to ask her how to best combine your workout and diet.
Focusing on endurance and mobility, Carrie has a passion for keeping fitness fun, whilst giving you a juicy workout.
Losing weight has never been easier. Carrie keeps me motivated and gives me tips regarding nutrition too.
My belly has never been this toned. I love it. Plus I lost 8 lbs in the process!
Hannah’s philosophy is focused on a balanced and holistic approach to building general strength while limiting dysfunction and preventing injury.

Working out is for everyone! We can all improve our physical and mental wellbeing with the right information and motivation. 

Hannah’s philosophy is focused on a balanced and holistic approach to building general strength while limiting dysfunction and preventing injury.

She believes that habit-forming and loving the way you move your body can create a lifelong change.
I used to be overweight. Hitting the gym was a no go. I was just too self conscious. Hannah helped me find my confidence again!
I am a keen swimmer and needed to find compensatory exercises for my body. Thanks to Hannah I know exactly what to do now.
Madison promotes incremental daily progress to achieve your goals.

Madison champions a client-centered coaching approach.

She values client input, feedback, and background to construct an individualized plan to fit their goals. 

Life is a marathon, not a sprint. Find your pace and keep going.
I have never really worked out. Madison has a great deal of understanding and goes at a pace that is right for me.
I feel better both physically and mentally. Light in my body and clear in my head! Thanks, Madison!
Steve believes in a bottom-up approach to achieving fitness goals.

Steve left his office job to follow his passion for fitness. Now he is helping people live healthier, happier, and more joyful lives.

Steve believes in a bottom-up approach to achieving fitness goals. At the start, building a solid foundation of basic movement patterns, then cultivating a love for exercise.

He builds strong and positive client relationships through excitement, motivation and humor.
If you want to work your body in a way it’s never worked before, then Steve is your guy.
I’ve been working out for a while but really wanted to nail my technique. \n\nSteve is all about sharpening your technique, so you’ll feel like you’re always improving.
From semi-pro boxer to personal trainer Amir knows a lot about hard work and tapping into your inner strength.

Are you ready to be pushed to your limits, build muscle and beat your PB over and over again? 

Amir's long experience in the industry will help you unlock your full potential and help you redefine your personal goals to reach the impossible. 

His passion for how the body works shines through. If you are ready to work hard and see results, then Amir is here for you.
I workout regularly but often I am stuck at what to do next. Amir gives me new tips and pushed me to be the best version of myself.
I love having access to a PT whenever I have a question to ask or when I just need that extra bit of motivational boost!
The cornerstones of Lin’s coaching are building physical fitness, good nutrition, plenty of hydration, metabolic conditioning, and recovery.

You could call him bit of a fitness geek. 

Lin wants to know how exactly the body works and how to gain results most efficiently.

He has experience coaching clients from an array of backgrounds, giving him the knowledge to accurately tailor individualized fitness programs for any client.

Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Sports Administration. He goes above and beyond to help you achieve your goal.
I wanted a real professional. Someone who knows his stuff. Lin’s knowledge about fitness and the human body is boundless. Thanks to him I saw progress after a couple of weeks.
Lin’s holistic approach to fitness is what’s helped me keep motivated. It is not just workout, workout, workout…he advises you on nutrition and recovery as well.
Chris was where you are now. Wanting to get stronger, fitter, and more resilient.

His approach is based on consistent workout plans and celebrating incremental improvements.

He will test your limits and work with you to overcome adversity. 

Chris believes that physical strength can be translated into mental strength as well.

Together, you will focus on reaching your maximum potential.
I was overweight but wanted to get fit and healthy for my kids. Chris helped me establish a routine and now I can keep up with my kids when they are running around :)
My posture was terrible. I spend most of my day behind a desk. Chris helped me strengthen my deep core and gives me compensation exercises to help me maintain a healthy back.

Take your time, there\'s no need to hurry.
Try to relax your neck muscles.
Do not overarch your lower back.
Use your abdominals to get up, your neck and shoulders are relaxed.
Try to keep your pelvis still.
Use your abs to resist the movement.
Do not pull on your neck with your hands.
Lift the bar in a straight trajectory.
Align your feet right below your knees.
Keep elbows about 75 degrees away from your body.
Pull the bar towards your belly button.

Use your abdominal muscles when coming up, not arms.
Do not sit on the floor.
Squeeze your glutes hard on top of the movement.
Push your belly button into the BOSU.
Head in line with the spine on top of the movement.
Turn the ball upside down to increase difficulty.
Breathe deeply. Do not hold your breath.
Breathe in going down, breathe out going up.
Breathe in going up, breathe out going down.
Breath in between your shoulder blades.
Breathe just below your rib cage.
Breath out when pulling elbows back, breath in when going forward.
Lift the dumbbell in a straight trajectory
Lift with your back and shoulders, not the arms.
Avoid lifting your hips from the bench.
Do not let your elbows go below the chest.

Kneel down to make it easier.

Place the foam roller under the pelvis.
Start with your shoulder resting on the foam roller.

Feel the muscles near your armpit.
Start with one side of your upper back on the foam roller.
Avoid rolling to the knee level.
Keep your core tight all the time.
Keep your head and pelvis in line with your spine.
Align the shoulders right above your wrists.
Squeeze your abdominal and gluteal muscles.
Be as fast as you can, but don\'t compromise the technique.
Stretch as far as you can without feeling any pain.
Focus on muscle contraction, the range of motion is not important.
Make sure you have a soft surface.
Do not slouch your upper back.
Swing your arms to the rhythm.
Try not to lean to one side.
Keep your back straight and stable.

Keep the pelvis in line with the spine.

Tuck your chin towards your chest.
Do not rotate your upper body.
Push your back into the mat.
Toes are pointing down to the ground.
Toes facing forward, bend your knee in line with your ankle.

Align your shoulders right above the elbows.
Focus on rounding your back evenly, rather than maximally bending it.
Keep your elbows close to the body.
Squeeze shoulder blades and then push them apart.
Keep your head in line with your spine.
Do not rest in the bottom position.

Maintain 3 points support - big toe, little toe, and the heel.

Knees should not go over your toes.

Whole foot stays on the ground.
Breath out with the movement, breath in going back.
Do not turn your feet out.

Keep the elbow close to the head.

Use lighter band to make it easier.

Slightly rotate the legs from side to side.
Do not drop your head too much.

Keep the bands straight and tight.
